topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542b725e6368727268d40000#post_542b725e6368727268d40000
Here's a random question: the game I'm working towards for my portfolio does have zombies in it as part of the type of enemies, they're slow moving, dumb as a brick, a shot to the brain or dismembering their limbs are the only way to stop them, but the question is that one out of twenty of them are smart and give them orders where to go; does this still fall in zombies?  They're still zombies and all, but the smart one basically plans with other smart ones to track you down.  Basically a zombie commanding officer.

The way it would work is that the dumb zombies would have very dumb AI that could be easily fooled, however they make clicks and gurgling noises and scream if they find you alerting the horde; the smart zombies all share the same AI director that then tell the dumb zombies where to go.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
